cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northeast, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend Thursday afternoon, then accelerate northeast across Georgia–South Carolina and emerge offshore near the North Carolina coast before turning farther northeast over the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachicola/St. Marks

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line FL (Tropical Storm Warning); Anclote River to Indian Pass FL (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida, then Atlantic coasts of GA, SC, and NC northward to the Mid-Atlantic and New England
weather_observation.wind: Tropical‐storm-force winds (40–50 mph gusts) possible Friday night into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation 1–3 ft possible along the lower Cape Fear and adjacent barrier islands if the center passes near the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with isolated amounts near 10 inches could produce flooding/flash-flooding in the Wilmington area Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and short-fuse coastal flooding during high‐tide cycles.
